content: Claude transformed coding in 2025, and in 2026, it will transform knowledge work.

The launch of Claude Opus 4.6 marks a watershed moment for AI becoming a real working partner for people in industries like finance and consulting who use spreadsheets, slide decks, and long documents.

The transformation of knowledge work by AI in 2026 will parallel the transformation of coding by AI in 2025, where 'vibe coding' (coined by @karpathy) allowed anyone to build software by describing their needs.
On internal benchmarks for real-world finance tasks, Opus 4.6 improved by over 23% compared to Sonnet 4.5, which was considered state-of-the-art recently.
The performance improvements of Opus 4.6 are demonstrated in tasks like building financial models, creating pitch decks, and M&A analysis, which typically take an analyst weeks.
Opus 4.6 produces first-pass deliverables that are significantly better, often landing where previous models required multiple rounds of revision or couldn't achieve at all.
To fully leverage AI model improvements, product integration is crucial, as seen with Claude Code which provided a user interface for applying coding advancements.

New product integrations like Cowork (allowing multiple analyses on a folder of files), Claude in Excel (handling multi-tab financial models), and Claude in PowerPoint (building and iterating presentations natively) are being shipped to apply Claude's capabilities where people work.
